title: `--daemon` mode ignores `-e` for first window with `msg create-window`
body:
I use another terminal to not interfere with alacritty instances. Then do:
- `alacritty --daemon`
- `alacritty msg create-window -e nnn`

→ Alacritty opens and is a child process of the daemon, as it should. It is a blank, interactive terminal window though. `nnn` (or any other command) did not execute. When using `alacritty msg create-window -e nnn` a second time, even after closing the first window, it works as intended.

### System

OS: Linux
Version: alacritty 0.14.0 (22a44757)
Linux/BSD: X11, i3wm

### Logs

Sadly, nothing of value. `alacritty msg create-window -e nnn` does not produce any output.

`alacritty --daemon` produces the following. 6.[…] is the first, unsuccessful use of `alacritty msg create-window`, 9.[…] is the second one.
